name: processionally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a procession (= a line of people moving in the same direction), or in a way that is similar to a procession: Len carried the box carefully inside, and the others trooped processionally behind him. The processionally serious prince we see on his duties becomes a very different man in private.
More examplesFewer examplesThe nuns, carrying candles, directed themselves processionally to the chapel.Her arrangements of bottles and vases are painted in tones of white and light grey and arranged processionally across the canvas.
